pr_title: Do not specify exercise dates in exam exercises

timeline.message: Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into feature/no-exercise-dates-in-exams

do not specify exercise dates in exam exercises

also allow to specify assessment due date in programming exercises

Removed date columns from table as they are not relevant for exam
exercises

Removed date columns from table as they are not relevant for exam
exercises
Removed show finished exercises checkbox for exam view
Made tutor-exercise-dashboard dates deal with null in case of exam

Modified getTextSubmissionWithoutAssessment to perform check with
exam daates
Modified createResultForExternalSubmission to support exam exercises
fix issue when due date is null
add additional validation for number of exercises in exam to prevent null pointer exception

timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure, but should this really depend on the last individual end date and not on the one belonging to the StudentExam to which the result belongs?
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: I was unsure here too, maybe @krusche can help
replies.author: stefanwaldhauser

replies.bodyText: This should use the individual due date. I would consider adding an appropriate method to ExamService that returns the individual due date for a student based on: StudentExamService.java Line 112
replies.author: MaisiKoleni

replies.bodyText:
Theoretically you are right and this should use the individual date.
However, I think the exam correction should NOT start before the last student exam is over.
So tutors should not even be able to navigate into the tutor exam dashboard in this case and then this check is fine as well
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: We disabled the tutor exam dashboard button until the last individual exam end date is reached. So this should be fine :)
replies.author: fde312

timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.author: JonasPetry

replies.bodyText: The current implementation is consistent with the regular assessment on Artemis.
replies.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: For non-exam exercises, you can also assess if no end date is specified.
replies.author: jpbernius

timeline.message: do not allow tutors to override assessment after the publish result date

timeline.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: @jpbernius  I do not understand your first comment: "The current implementation is consistent with the regular assessment on Artemis."
replies.author: stefanwaldhauser

timeline.bodyText: While this seems to be a correct implementation, it is hard to follow that this method does a useful check for non-exam exercises. See further comment in ExamSubmissionService.
timeline.author: jpbernius

timeline.bodyText:
I am wondering if this is the correct place for this method. I would prefer this to be part of a exam independent service.
The way this is currently used makes it hard to understand that this method does have relevance for non-exam exercises if not reading the comment (which I found hard to understand).
timeline.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: @jpbernius I moved it to the SubmissionService :)
replies.author: fde312
